page.title: 06MUNDON - WHAT CROPS TO GROW?
page.content: The price of cereals is falling dramatically and so farmers might start growing different crops.A few years ago wheat was selling at Â£127 @ ton but now it only fetches Â£97.At the same time the price of fertilizer, insecticide,weedkiller etc. has risen. Farmers think the situation is going to get even worse and so they are thinking of trying more profitable crops such as sunflowers and lupins. Oil can be extracted from both of these plants.The Common Market offers a guaranteed price for oil seed rape and that has become a popular crop. Some farmers will not grow it because the flower has such an unpleasant smell. Because of these problems farmers are thinking of going back to mixed farming. By Pamela Mardon,Joanne Porter,K. Wood
